reviews.text: cute place and food was very delicious~ thank you
Really enjoyed the food. The service was exceptional. Definitely expensive.

Not up to par with other one star restaurants. Service was rushed and unfriendly. Food lacked a unique flavor profile. Final dish prior to dessert was a rice bowl with micro greens: a lame period on a boring sentence of a meal. Not worth the $200 paid.

Out of all the Michelin restaurants Iâ€™ve been to around the world and even in New York this one fell short.
The food was great but wasnâ€™t enough to fill us up and 2/8 of the tasting menu courses were dessert and both were cold ice cream or sorbets. I felt like there couldâ€™ve been more savory or slightly larger portions.
We were also celebrating my partners birthday which the host asked us about when seating is but didnâ€™t get a candle or anything at the end which we saw was given to other tables. The back door by the bar where we were seating was kept open for half the dinner and was cold and also didnâ€™t make the space feel as inviting. The service felt a bit disorganized and overall not worth over $500 for 2 people with drinks. Mari which is owned by the same chef felt much more inviting and made us more satisfied and lived up the Michelin star would recommend that over Kochi any day.
The food tastes great. Every dish has a very balanced flavor. I also did the wagyu upgrade for the main and it tasted amazing. The wagyu melts in your mouth.
Excellent
SchÃ¶ne ausgefallene KÃ¼che und sehr lecker. Auch die Weinbegleitung ist echt das Geld wert. Aber nehmt lieber einen Platz innen. Das Patio ist "offen" und man sitzt effektiv auf dem BÃ¼rgersteig.
Outstanding! We never miss a chance to visit Kochi.

Kochi is truly special! The tasting menu is a perfect balance of creativity and comfort â€” every course tells a story and bursts with flavor. The presentation is stunning, and the ingredients are top quality. The space feels cozy and modern, and the staff are warm, attentive, and passionate about what they do. Itâ€™s an unforgettable dining experience that beautifully blends tradition with innovation.

Loved our experience here. The servers were attentive and friendly. The dishes were delicate and layered with flavor and textures to die for. Our favorites were the mushroom medley appetizer and the octopus skewers. Had a fun, upbeat vibe and didnâ€™t feel overly formal like some fine dining places. It embraced the street food inspiration while still feeling very refined. We didnâ€™t get alcohol but did enjoy the mocktails and tea selection.
The scallops and mushroom bisque were amazing, would recommend and come back again.

Celebrated my husbandâ€™s birthday here tonight! Every aspect of our dinner felt special and memorable. Each course was a unique experience. The service was outstanding â€“ the entire staff was friendly and efficient. I am gluten-free and our waitress, Sarah, took extra care to explain any changes made to my dishes to accommodate that. I appreciated her attention to detail so I knew exactly what I was eating. We had an incredible meal and canâ€™t wait to come back!
A Michelin-starred Korean skewer tasting experience that elevates simple ingredients into art
They totally deserve their one star Michelin. Food and wine pairings were outstanding and great service to boot. Definitely recommended if you're in Hell's Kitchen

A world of flavor in a small corner of Hell's Kitchen. Beautiful presentation and modern execution. Most dishes are kept lighter than we're usually exposed to in most American Korean dishes in order to keep you going through the full milti course meal. The fish and meats were both perfectly cooked and had many flavors of the flame they were grilled with. A scallop dish upon pickled root vegetables was a highlight of the tiny plates. The meal ended beautifully with a 3 piece ballet of sorbet, banana, and creams. The staff was as exceptionally accommodating as the flavors. The star was deserved.
Came here for my birthday dinner based on google reviews. Not a single course disappointed
Very filling tasting menu and great service
Great hangout spot with delicious food! Service was a little slow, but overall good experience!

What an experience! This was probably one of the best restaraunts I have ever been to and it was well worth the Michelin stars that it was given.

From the service of the staff, to the explanation and taste of the food, it was incredible!

Small venue so nice and intimate, well worth it to make a reservation to ensure you get a seat. Expensive, but worth every penny.

Have been here a couples years ago and was floored. This time not so much. We did the tasting menu and drink pairing before and it was incredible. Drink sizes were full and the size of the dishes felt appropriate. We were there for over 2 hours and spent $722, well worth it.

Decided to give it a second try for our 10th anniversary. Wouldnâ€™t say I was underwhelmed, but just whelmedâ€¦ some dishes were still great like the signatures, and the pallet cleanser was one of the bestâ€¦.but some just made me hungrier because they didnâ€™t hit. Portions felt smaller as well. We did the drink pairing again, but this time it felt very small. Pours didnâ€™t even make it past the angle at the bottom of the glass. Also felt very rushed. Were were collecting drinks to try and savor as dishes dropped. There was no time to savor the compliments of them when temperature was against you. This time we paidâ€¦$728 for 2 peopleâ€¦ and was under and hour and a half. Way too much money for what this was-second time around.

Takeaway: Just say itâ€™s your bday or anniversary so at least you get another dish on the house.

We came here in 2023 and loved it. This time it was a very different experience. The food this time was very underwhelming for a Michelin star restaurant. Itâ€™s good, donâ€™t get me wrong, but for the price itâ€™s far too much.

We also got the wine pairing last time too and it was amazing!  The pours were hearty. This time the pours were so tiny, we got about 3 glasses of wine total.  We should have just gotten a bottle or two for far less than the price for the pairing.

I had a great time last night, thanks to the staff for letting me sit at the bar without a Rez. I had a conference in Hells Kitchen and went to the chefs sister restaurants last year. I am a big fan of Korean food and throughly enjoyed the experience at Kochi. -Phil
Second visit to this restaurant.  Everything was exceptional!  We will definitely come again!

The interior here shows planning and care. You can see quality in the decorative details. This place offers tasty options and superior staff. Furthermore, the team never fails to be friendly. I'm scheduling another visit next week!

Kochi serves great food, but it's a dangerous place for people with lung disease like me to eat.

At 9 pm on Feb. 16, 2024 I took my wife to dinner at Kochi on 10th avenue in Manhattan to celebrate Valentine's day. They sat us at a table in a tent on the avenue's sidewalk. The temperature outside was 38 degrees.

Four Dura Heat model DH2304S heaters that burn kerosene heated the tent.

I've had asthma since about 2000, and was worried that the heaters would harm me, so I asked a Kochi manager to move us inside. They said that they couldn't because they had no free tables.

They eventually moved us inside, but even there we smelled kerosene in the air.

Shortly after we left Kochi that evening, I felt weak and lethargic from my involuntary exposure to the air pollution emitted by the heaters. In the days and weeks that followed, I felt weak, and suffered muscle aches, headaches, and coughing. My quality of life sank: I stopped socializing with friends, my wife and I canceled a vacation and stopped having sex. I stopped exercising. I watched every Seinfeld episode.

On Monday, May 20, 2024 I started exhibiting symptoms of sepsis, a life-threatening condition. I was confused and extremely fatigued. Fortunately, my sister, an infectious disease MD, recognized this, and my wife and sister took me to Cedars Sinai Medical Center, where I required 4 days of treatment.

It took me another couple of months to fully regain my strength.

Since then I've learned that the caution warning on the model DH2304S heaters says "ALWAYS OPERATE HEATERS WITH DOORS OF ROOM OPEN." and the owner's manual says "RISK OF INDOOR AIR POLLUTION USE HEATER ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. People with breathing problems should consult a physician before using the heater."

But the tent had no ventilation. And Kochi did not post a warning about the dangers the heaters posed to "people with breathing problems".

Now I'm fully recovered, but I nearly died. And the experience destroyed about 4 months of my life.

Kochi, you should stop using kerosene heaters. Dura Heat, you should stop selling heaters to restaurants.

Diners, beware.
Interesting food concept! Nice execution and friendly service.

Excellent evening out - sat at the chefsâ€™ counter and enjoyed the tasting menu. The menu featured a variety of Korean - French fusion with ingredients also sourced from Japan. Everything was seasonal and scrumptious.  High end cuisine through and through.

Decor could be slightly dressed up but will return. Food quality worth a return trip.

Cocktail program was exceptional. Their mushroom martini was truly spectacular. Bravo.

I wasted time by not coming sooner. Staff members demonstrate warmth instead of coldness. Their dishes reveal their standards without explanation. The bill stays reasonable while the plates satisfy. We're making this a regular spot.
Unique and creative tasting menu. Amazing service!

Kochi offers exceptional food and outstanding service. The dishes are thoughtfully curated, blending traditional Korean flavors with contemporary techniques, and the ingredients are fresh and flavorful.

In addition, the team was attentive to feedbackâ€”for example, adjusting seasoning after I mentioned a dish soup was slightly saltyâ€”and even surprised me with an additional dessert to celebrate my work milestone. A truly memorable dining experience! Highly recommend!

Not sure why it took me a year to write this review, but what an incredible experience. I was on a solo trip to New York for a couple of days and this was my first time at a Michelin starred restaurant and it totally lived up to it. The service was so engaging, the margarita was so good, each course was perfect. All hits, no misses, the best "splurge" meal I've ever had in my life up to that point, and remains it, a year later after a few more Michelin starred/recommended spots. It was just so impressive.
went in april from california! safe to say we loved it. all the dishes were divine and the staff was very attentive to us.

Kochi delivers a refined yet soulful Korean tasting menu thatâ€™s both inventive and deeply comforting. The skewer-based courses are beautifully paced, with standouts like the abalone and perilla-wrapped bites.

Service is warm, the vibe is intimate without being stuffy, and each dish feels intentional and memorable. Definitely a place to visit with friends or special occasions.
8 course chef choice. everything was delicious and service was excellent. Price is reasonable. Definitely a repeat. Discovered a new shoju called "Seoul Night" light and refreshing.
Great food, great service, friendly atmosphere.  My wife and I were tight on time and they worked with us.  Highly recommend!
What a delightful dining experience. Do go to Kochi!
Staff went above and beyond to ensure we were happy.

I dined at Kochi today with my husband and sister, and unfortunately, the experience fell far short of expectationsâ€”especially for a Michelin-starred restaurant. The atmosphere was underwhelming and felt very average, not what youâ€™d anticipate for a $200-per-person meal.

The food itself tasted decent, though it was noticeably salty. But the bigger issue: both my sister and I became extremely sick shortly after the meal. My sister had diarrhea before even leaving the restaurant, and I followed 20 minutes later. This is completely unacceptable, especially at this price point.

Iâ€™ve dined at many omakase and tasting-menu restaurants across NYC, even ones at much lower price points, and Iâ€™ve never experienced any stomach issues before. This was a firstâ€”and not in a good way.

Safe to say, we wonâ€™t be returning and cannot recommend Kochi based on our experience.

This is our first Michelin experience and it totally disappointed us. We each paid $217 for the 8â€“course meal and we all got diarrhea after dinner. Food is mediocre at best (at least 2 out of 6 savory dishes were salty) and tables were so close to each other that I could clearly hear the conversation of the people who sat at the table next to us. I donâ€™t think the experience and the food here worth the money we paid for. On top of that, we all suffered from the diarrhea. The only good thing is the service we received from the servers, but it doesnâ€™t compensate for the bad quality of the food we had here.

Please donâ€™t come to this restaurant. There are many better restaurants in NYC. This restaurant is overhyped by the Michelin title and you will more likely be disappointed like us if you dine here.
its good atmosphere and good food
Best of the best. Good food, amazing staff. Excellent atmosphere.

Just had one of the best dining experiences at Kochi in NYC ğŸ¤
We went for the eight-course tasting menu â€” an homage to Korean royal cuisine with a street food twist â€” and every single dish felt like a little gem. âœ¨

From the clean, delicate flavors of the hwe course to the bold textures in the shrimp bibimbapâ€¦ I was honestly blown away. We added the abalone and Iberico pork from the chefâ€™s special menu to round it all out â€” highly recommend doing the same if you go!

Each course is so thoughtfully crafted, seasonal, and full of flavor. Michelin-rated for a reason ğŸ‘ğŸ¼

Tasting Menu $145 pp

The food is worth 4 or 5 stars but we had a difficult experience last night, seated outside.  There were many mosquitoes and we had a lot of bites.  Toward the end of the meal we realized there was a fan behind us but it was off.  When turned on that helped a bit.  The waiter should have turned it on at the beginning.  There was also a fan in front of us but the table under it had aimed it at them so we weren't getting any wind from that.  The food was very good, especially the halibut, wagyu and bibimbap.  the "hwe" was bland and the carrot sorbet didn't come together.  The final dessert was just OK.  Two nights ago I had dinner at Frevo and it was MUCH better.

Had a wonderful meal at this restaurant! The dishes were fresh, tasty, and clearly made with care. The staff was warm and professional, always checking in to make sure we had everything we needed. Great atmosphere and even better food â€“ will definitely be coming back!

We didn't have a reservation but they were able to accommodate us with bar seats. I appreciated them accommodating my allergies and swapping out the ingredients. This spot was on my list to try out so glad I did but I don't think it was so good I'd go back. If you're in the area, check it out. Sometimes you can leave prix fixe a little hungry but didn't feel that way with this spot. What makes me give it a 4 (and maybe a smidge under 4) is that the food wasnt wow. The best dish was the Wagyu and morels. The korean flavours didn't seem integrated and sometimes a little superficial (adding a bit of fermented paste or gochujang isn't quite enough). The perilla and tomato jelly with Hamachi could've had potential but fell a bit short. Some of the dishes like the sorbet and and banana milk did a good job of incorporating the essence of Korean cuisine without being too much on the nose. Long story short, give it a try if you're in the area and there's a seat open but I wouldn't recommend going out of your way.

I have been to Kochi five times and they never disappoint.  The courses are not only consistently interesting but they also taste goodâ€¦as opposed to some fixed menus that just hit â€˜interestingâ€™.   The service is top notch.  Really good team work and just the right amount of connection without intruding.  And they recognize you when you come back.  Shorter wine list but great selection.  Warm  comfortable decor.  Absolutely love Kochi!

Incredible tasting menu, really enjoyed it. Not quite at the top when it comes to Korean fine dining in the city, but for the price itâ€™s hard to beat. The abalone, octopus, and steak were all incredible. Really enjoyed all the deserts as well.

Absolutely incredible. We made it to their last brunch service and hyein and Sarah were so hospitable and kind. To me, kochi is a Hellâ€™s Kitchen institution that continues to deliver some of the best food and hospitality in the city. Itâ€™s an incredible value and you really taste quality (with a little side of quantity!)

I've had many Michelin starred tasting menus throughout North America and Europe and Kochi is one of my favorites so far. Exciting, spicy, delicious food, perfect drink pairings, and genuine care and connection from the staff. My partner doesn't drink, so I requested an NA pairing for him if possible and they knocked it out of the park. I hope they make it a regular feature!

My wife and visited here a few days ago, and it was, quite simply, the best meal either of us has ever had. Both the food and the service were perfect. Iâ€™m not sure when weâ€™ll next visit NYC, but I AM sure that, when we do, weâ€™ll make reservations at Kochi again.

Everything about appetizer/main/dessert/drinks/service was amazing. Pleasantly sophisticated taste experiences with lots of details and cares made it such a good memory.

-I really enjoyed it overall because I got the impression that menus here tried very hard to make right balance between keeping Korean cuisineâ€™s identity and yet appealing to non-Korean folks. For example of Eggplant Twigim (one of my fav), the rice cake with its sweet spicy sauce well reminded common street food in Korea, but its overall taste quality is so elevated and putting chestnut hummus on the rice cake made it completely different taste experience. (good way)
-The 2nd most interesting menu was Corn Soup which came out as the first appetizer. It had three different steps of having it and each steps provided completely different taste experiences of savory/crunchy/comforting. Not just tastes were good, but it made me so excited for what was coming next so it was one of perfect way to serve its job as opening appetizer.
-The most â€œinterestingâ€ one was actually cocktail Nangmeyon but I wouldnâ€™t recommend it unless you already well know what common Korean cold noodle is like and that you like it. Strictly speaking for taste perspective, I liked Jeju Escape better as it had very good balance of bitterness and fruity sweetness.
-Not that it was bad, but adding sea urchin to snowcrab bibimbap might not be well worth it because the menu as is already provides amazing flavor, so spending more bucks on extra sea urchin didnâ€™t feel like well money spent.

This was probably the best restaurant experience I had in Manhattan for this particular year. No wonder I will be coming back again.

My review is based on my visit about one year ago. My friend and I had a course menu and every single menu was very satisfying, fun experience. Drinks, not featured in the photos, were definitely worth mentioning too. I remember the place being a little noisy but overall, we had a really great time and enjoyed our meal.

5 stars: price for quality ratio is quite solid. The food was stunning and delicious. The service was very friendly, just a great dining experience.

We did the tasting menu plus the abalone course. They were able to accommodate a pescatarian menu which I appreciated! I also got the apricot NA drink which was so good and refreshing.

Standouts for us were:
- white asparagus soup with the croquette: just a stunning dish to kick off the meal. So fresh and deep and a great balance of textures.
- crispy cakes: messy but delicious.
- the smoky fava beans along with the main course
- abalone: this was an add on but it's not easy to find in Ny and was pretty good overall! The foam was a little hard to scoop but good flavors.

Would definitely recommend! We sat outside but it's on a relatively loud corner so I'd recommend sitting inside. Enjoy!

My friend and I had a truly exceptional dining experience at Kochi last week. Each dish featured a distinct and thoughtfully crafted flavor profile, executed with precision and care. Highlights of the tasting menu included the halibut with caviar and the sea urchin bibimbap. The halibut was delicately cooked and remarkably tender, while the uni added a luxurious texture and depth to the bibimbap.

Our experience was further elevated by the sommelier, Nicholas, whose expertly curated wine pairings complemented each course beautifully and showcased the finesse of the cuisine. Kochi is undoubtedly one of New York Cityâ€™s must-try restaurantsâ€”an experience not to be missed.

My friend Sarah chose to visit New York this week with her family. We hadn't seen each other since MasterChef, so it felt wonderful to reconnect. We had a gathering of nine, thanks to our amazing friend Ross, who made the reservation, along with Trang.

The food was incredible! My favorites were the octopus and halibut with that flavorful consommÃ©. The desserts were fantastic as well. Overall, the experience was delightful, and the strawberry field drink was quite tasty too!

Food and service was amazing ! And the atmosphere was super local and lovely wooden tables. The waiters were so kind and accommodated us the entire night. Wagyu was delicious as were all the starters, ceviche and halibut dishes being standout and carrot sorbet for dessert was ğŸ‘ŒğŸ» thanks for having us !!!

Kochi was an excellent dining experience all the way through. The staff is so friendly and attentive and the atmosphere elevated by a chill interior and playlist. The starting 2 dishes start the meal off perfectly, and amazing meals continue all the way through. We ordered and really liked the black truffle dumpling to break up the tasting menu. This spot was awesome, and hearing that small menu changes are made on a frequent basis are an exciting pull to come back in the future.
Such a delightful brunch! We were there this past Sunday with a party of four. Everything we had was absolutely delicious. The tostadas & steak + omurice were standouts!!

We loved Kochi. It was our first taste of fine dining Korean and it was exceptional. Everything was cooked and presented beautifully, the wine we were recommended was a great match to the tasting menu and the staff were all wonderful and answered our questions about the food they were serving up.

While the food was good, it definitely wasn't standout enough to make me want to go back or hold it up to other Michelin restaurants.

Each dish was presented perfectly, but the flavours were muted and nothing really stood out other than the iberico meat dish. For a korean inspired place, you could barely tell except for some dishes which then were probably the best ones of the night.

Everything and I mean EVERYTHING was a burst of flavors so amazing, you wanted more!! My husband and I enjoyed celebrating our 4th anniversary here and the fact they allowed, in fact welcomed our 21-month old to join us was the icing on the cake. We will definitely return for more celebrations in our lives. Thank you to the team of Kochi!

I was taken here for my birthday, and we had a truly exquisite evening, a sensational, New York dining experience.

Every dish on the tasting menu was well thought out, expertly prepared and beautifully presented. The crew definitely takes the endeavor seriously, and it is reflected in the quality of the meal. I had the beverage pairing, which was also wonderful. All of the Wines or sake were selected with care and accompanied each dish beautifully.

The service was extremely professional and friendly, it was a pleasure to sit at the counter and watch the team preparing each course.

Definitely would like to go back here for another special occasion, or perhaps just a fun evening to treat ourselves.

My husband took me here for my birthday. We drove 3 hours for our first Michelin star restaurant and it was so worth it. I honestly thought I wouldn't like everything because I didn't have the high class palate and I was so nervous about the social environment, but I was so wrong. It was an amazing experience. We ate ALL 9 dishes on the tasting menu. I highly recommend the A5 wagyu upgrade! All the dishes were very distinct and had tons of different flavors. It was so delicious and the service was incredible. They were so friendly and I had a great night!

What can I say? This is one of the best tasting menus Iâ€™ve experienced! Every dish was incredibly deliciousâ€”elevated without being overly fancy or trying too hard, just genuinely good food. Unlike some tasting menus, I actually left feeling nicely full. They were also fantastic about accommodating dietary restrictions, which made the experience even better. For the quality and creativity of the dishes, the value is outstanding. The atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming, not stuffy, and the service was excellent. I enjoyed every single course!

Korean traditional course meal distilled into a fusion kochi (skewer) form.

Among Michelin-starred Korean fine dining spots, Kochi offers one of the most unique concepts. Rather than focusing on fusion or highlighting specific dishes, Kochi presents a complete Korean multi-course experience (each dish representing a classic element of traditional dining). For those unfamiliar with Korean course meals, it might feel a bit mundane, but for me, it carried a fun and nostalgic charm.

A typical Korean course meal begins with a light soup and raw seafood, and Kochiâ€™s first two starters beautifully reflected this tradition. Along with the Chefâ€™s special Abalone, these starters were elevated with playful sweet acidity. The course then transitioned seamlessly into savory acidity with the Octopus Twigim and Halibut. The halibut was my favorite dish from the first half of the mealâ€”a creative take on dried pollock bean sprout soup (ì½©ë‚˜ë¬¼ë¶ì–´êµ­). The Jiri consommÃ© deepened the flavors with its umami and spice, while the lightly fried tofu and delicate halibut added textural dimensions to the dish.

Just like in a Korean meal, the entrÃ©es werenâ€™t limited to just one. Instead, they were divided into 3 parts: 2 meat dishes and, of course, bibimbapâ€”because no Korean meal feels complete without it. My favorite was the American wagyuâ€”decently fatty, paired with a rich truffle sauce, and the chewy yet slightly creamy barley risotto made it very satisfying. On the other hand, the flank steak felt like a simple bulgogi with a different pork cutâ€”not particularly innovative and probably the plainest dish of the evening.

Then the Mandarin Sorbet. Best palate cleanser Iâ€™ve ever had. The way they layered textures and acidity in this seemingly simple dish was divine. The bursting texture of finger lime, silky smooth calico foam, and the bright citrus supreme all came together beautifully. The white sesame dessert was a tad disappointing as they subtle sesame and ginger flavors were completely overpowered by caramel. Thankfully, the chef provided a complimentary passionfruit posset, and this was absolutely fire.

The chef must be arrested. How can we enjoy Korean food in another restaurant after eating at Kochi?!!ğŸ˜†

Joke aside, very special place.

The staff is very friendly and helpful, they feed you with food and information.

Please be careful, you only can bug the taste menu - as of 2024, itâ€™s around 150 USD / Person.

I found it a little expensive, especially if you sit outside and â€œenjoyâ€ regular central Manhattan view.

Anyway, good place for celebrations.

Finally getting around to leaving a review. Better late than never.

My wife and I dined here the summer of 2023. We splurged on the chef's table experience and loved it. The food was impeccable, the hospitality was warm and welcoming, and the atmosphere was cozy yet comfortable.

Good hospitality and great food. We said "yes" to all the upgrades. Worth it. Flat iron steak to A5 wagyu, black truffle supplement, sea urchin supplement. I recommend this spot to anyone looking to venture North of the craziness in Midtown.

We had a very good experience at Kochi. The food was top knotch. However, for a Michelin Star restaurant and for the amount of money paid, I feel it could have been better.  There were 2 dishes that seemed too salty (a broth), and then there was one that seemed to use too much miso or maybe bonito? Then, there is no dishes to cleanse or prepare your pallet for the next course.
Also, during one presentation of a dish, a soup base was poured over fish, and the server spilled a few drops on the table but never attempted to clean it. If we were not paying so much, it would not be a big deal at all, but I've been to steakhouses that were more attentive.
The staff did provide us with 3 different desserts for our anniversary. That was nice.

El lugar es pequeÃ±o, pero acogedor. Nos asignaron un lugar en la barra y podÃ­amos ver como preparaban los alimentos, es toda una experiencia. Cada platillo estÃ¡ delicadamente preparado, con ingredientes de calidad. Pedimos el menÃº del chef y fueron 9 platillos en total, todo estuvo delicioso y tuvieron el gran gesto de regalarnos un postre extra por ser nuestra luna de miel. Sin duda lo recomiendo, no es barato, pero vale la pena.

Visited in Feb 2025

Had made a reservation for dinner at Kochi before catching a Broadway show. The tasting menu is a 9 course experience with one optional additional course (the Chefâ€™s Special) for an additional amount. I did add the additional Chefâ€™s special which was an abalone course and it was fantastic. There was also the option to upgrade a couple of courses in the menu with additional premium ingredients for those wishing to.

The tasting menu is very reasonably priced (versus other similar Michelin star restaurants in NY) and the dinner was a good amalgamation of creative preparations, traditional flavours and an overall unpretentious experience. The restaurant definitely deserves its one Michelin star.

For drinks, I ordered a couple of cocktails (the Fig Negroni and the Spiced Korean Pear Margherita) and both were quite good. Would definitely recommend Negroni lovers to try the Fig Negroni. There is a also a detailed wine list for folks who are interested.

Service was impeccable.

Overall, the dinner was a very nice experience and Iâ€™d definitely recommend folks to visit Kochi if theyâ€™re interested in Korean fine dining.

Amazing service. Food was absolutely outstanding. Every course was surprising and illuminating, some of the best food we've ever had. We paid $476 for two, without the wine pairing. A few notes that the music was quite loud and the wagyu did not come out hot. They also asked us to leave midway through the last dessert course even though we waited more than ten minutes for some of the courses to come out and were not loitering whatsoever. Was a bit surprising.

What a phenomenal experience! I would certainly love to go back. The meal and experience were a lot of fun. The dishes of the tasting menu were delicious, flavorful, and fun, featuring seasonal ingredients. I'm not big fan of Korean food but this place is exceptional. Itâ€™s at the same time faithful to Korean cuisine while being highly creative and inventive.

This was probably the best food I ever had in the US and most definitely the best Korean I ever had. The 9 course tasting menu is truly a lifechanging experience for your tastebuds and certainly for the eye. Hard to say which course I enjoyed the most, but probably the grilled Octopus and the pork chops. Maybe the watermelon gazpacho or the corn ice cream. The price is comparably cheap for what you get here, given that Kochi has been awarded a Michellin star. Wine and cocktails also just fantastic.
Tiny, tiny room for improvement is the look and feel of the tables - I gave been sitting outside. Either use tablecloth or make sure the tables donâ€™t look like old, cheap, plastic stuff that you would find anywhere else in New York. Your tableware, though, was stunning and beautiful.
100% recommendation for fine dining in New York.

One of the best bang for your buck tasting courses ($145 with no add ons) Iâ€™ve had in NYC. Would recommend adding uni to the bibimbap however for $16. Great price and I left feeling very satisfied.

All of the dishes were delightful and I had no complaints at all. Korean flavors were definitely there but with a nice modern twist that doesnâ€™t stray too far from traditional. My favorites were the galbi jjim and bibimbap.

Service was great as well; they gave us an extra dessert for celebrating our anniversary.

WORTH IT. Itâ€™s definitely a bit steep in price, but they really let you take your time to enjoy each dish and your water/drink is always kept full. The interior is cute and the staff are all very kind and patient. Zero complaints from my experienceâ€” in fact, we had originally booked for a table outside, and they last minute accommodated us inside since it was so hot. Thank you ğŸ« 
Give yourself at least 2 hours to enjoy this tasting menu! Definitely book in advance, and be aware that there are a lot of fish dishes (but theyâ€™re all very different in presentation and taste, so no flavor fatigue!).
Great date spot or fancy dinner for a special occasion. Thank you for having us â˜ºï¸
